title: Emmerdale spoilers: Robert and Aaron flee in double exit drama
text:
Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) has been enjoying what little time he’s got left before going to prison with Aaron Dingle (Danny Miller) in Emmerdale, but in the coming episodes he’s left devastated once more when he learns that Lee has died — something which forces him and Aaron to make a huge decision about their future.

Upon learning that her rapist has died, Victoria (Isabel Hodgins) heads round to inform Robert of the devastating news, as she knows that it will no doubt have a huge impact on the prison sentence he’s set to serve. After Victoria’s revelation, Robert is unable to process what he’s learned‚ knowing that this new development could mean he’ll be charged with murder.

Amid all of the confusion, Liv (Isobel Steele) suggests that Robert not only goes on the run, but that he takes Aaron with him. After some discussion, Robert and Aaron agree to do just that, but — upon coming to such a decision — they are hit by the reality of the situation, and what it means for their future.

They set off to bid farewell to their nearest and dearest, and Aaron reveals everything to Chas (Lucy Pargeter) — who’s understandably distraught at the prospect of losing her son.

On Robert and Aaron’s decision, Danny Miller said: ‘The goodbyes are rushed. You can see that Aaron and Robert almost don’t have time to take in the emotion due to the rush and panic. The police are essentially on their way, it’s all so quick, it’s a serious crime so he can’t be out on bail.’

‘They both say their individual goodbyes but I don’t think they realise this could be the final time they speak to people.’

The married couple bid adieu to their loved ones before driving off, ready to start their new adventure.

The question is: will they managed to evade the law?
